summary: This document contains a series of FAA forms and reports related to the airworthiness and maintenance of an aircraft registered as N188TS, owned by Thorair LLC. It includes details about repairs, alterations, and compliance with aviation regulations, specifically regarding the installation of Automatic Dependent Surveillance-Broadcast (ADS-B) systems. This document contains Instructions for Continued Airworthiness (ICA) related to various aircraft models, detailing the necessary equipment, maintenance practices, and inspection requirements for Automatic Dependent Surveillance-Broadcast (ADS-B) systems. It outlines the specifications for avionics and aircraft technicians to ensure compliance with FAA regulations. This document contains instructions for continued airworthiness related to various aircraft types, detailing inspection and maintenance practices, equipment installation, and troubleshooting procedures. It includes specific references to manuals and guidelines for non-destructive testing and visual inspections, emphasizing the importance of regular maintenance to ensure aircraft safety. This document contains various FAA forms related to aircraft maintenance and airworthiness certifications for the Raytheon Aircraft Company Model 400A, specifically registration number N188TS. It includes details about repairs, alterations, and compliance with aviation regulations, as well as correspondence regarding discrepancies in airworthiness certification. This document contains various FAA forms and certificates related to the airworthiness of a Raytheon Aircraft Company 400A, serial number RK-244. It details modifications made to the aircraft, including engine replacements and installations of various systems, along with the necessary approvals and certifications required for compliance with FAA regulations. This document contains various references to aircraft maintenance and alterations related to a Beechjet 400A owned by Flight Options, LLC. It includes details about airworthiness certifications, equipment installations, and authorizations for FAA actions. The document is subject to a protective order, indicating sensitive information. This document contains technical specifications and maintenance records related to the modification and certification of a Beechcraft 400A aircraft, specifically focusing on the installation of various electronic systems and components. It includes details about the aircraft's registration, ownership, and compliance with FAA regulations. This document contains multiple FAA Form 337 entries related to major repairs and alterations made to the aircraft with registration mark N493LX, owned by Flight Options LLC. It details various modifications and repairs performed by Nextant Aerospace, including installation of new components and compliance with airworthiness standards. This document contains various FAA compliance statements regarding modifications and repairs made to a Hawker Beechcraft 400A aircraft, including details about engineering orders and certifications. It includes signatures from engineering representatives and outlines the compliance with airworthiness standards. This document contains multiple FAA Form 337 entries related to major repairs and alterations performed on the Hawker Beechcraft 400A aircraft, registration N493LX. The forms detail various modifications, compliance with airworthiness standards, and approvals by designated engineering representatives. This document is a Statement of Compliance with Airworthiness Standards issued by the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) for a Hawker Beechcraft 400A aircraft. It details the engineering data necessary for substantiation of compliance with specific regulatory requirements related to aircraft repair procedures. This document is a structural analysis report prepared by Lee Products Engineering Services, Inc. for modifications made to Beechcraft Model 400A aircraft. It details the compliance of the modifications with Federal Aviation Regulations and includes descriptions of the work accomplished, including interior refurbishments and installations. This document contains a series of statements of compliance with airworthiness standards for the Beechjet 400A aircraft, specifically for modifications and structural approvals related to aircraft components. It includes details about the applicant, Constant Aviation, and various engineering representatives involved in the certification process. This document is a maintenance manual supplement from Aviation Fabricators Inc. detailing the continued airworthiness and maintenance requirements for a specific cabin configuration modification in aircraft. It includes inspection schedules, installation instructions, and safety requirements for the divan assembly and restraint system. This document contains various FAA forms and compliance statements related to the airworthiness of a Raytheon Aircraft Company model 400A, registration N493LX, serial number RK244. It includes details about maintenance requirements, operating limitations, and authorization letters for agents involved in the aircraft's operations. This document contains technical details regarding the certification and maintenance of a Beechjet 400A aircraft, registration number N493LX, owned by Flight Options LLC. It includes information about the aircraft's specifications, maintenance requirements, and the issuance of a Special Airworthiness Certificate for research and development purposes. This document contains various FAA forms related to major repairs and alterations made to aircraft, specifically a Beechcraft 400A with registration N493LX. It details the installation of equipment, compliance with FAA regulations, and the certification process for modifications. The document includes references to specific engineering orders, maintenance manuals, and installation instructions. The document appears to be a communication regarding aircraft serial numbers related to installations performed using a specific STC (Supplemental Type Certificate). It references the need for data to authorize additional installations and includes a fax number for correspondence. The content is largely technical and does not provide significant information related to the Epstein case. This document contains various FAA forms related to major repairs and alterations of aircraft, specifically detailing modifications made to a Raytheon 400A aircraft. It includes information about the aircraft's registration, repairs performed, and compliance with federal aviation regulations. The document is subject to protective orders and contains multiple references to FAA forms and approvals.

events.title: Issuance of Airworthiness Certificate
events.description: The FAA issued an airworthiness certificate for the aircraft N188TS, certifying it for safe operation.

events.title: Return to Service Approval
events.description: The FAA approved the return to service for the aircraft after necessary repairs and inspections were completed.

events.title: Installation of ADS-B Out
events.description: Installation of Automatic Dependent Surveillance-Broadcast Out on the aircraft was completed in compliance with FAA regulations.

events.title: Airworthiness Certificate Review
events.description: A review of the airworthiness certificate for aircraft N188TS revealed a discrepancy regarding the required Nationality letter.

events.title: Repair and Alteration Certification
events.description: Repairs and alterations to the aircraft were certified by Steven A. Watkins and David Kerr.

events.title: Application for Airworthiness Certificate
events.description: ThorAir, LLC submitted an application for a new airworthiness certificate for the aircraft after a change in registration number.

events.title: Engine Installation
events.description: Installation of Williams International FJ44-3AP engines in place of Pratt & Whitney engines was completed.

events.title: Agent Authorization
events.description: Flight Options, LLC authorized Nextant Aerospace, LLC to act as its agent for FAA actions regarding the Beechjet 400A.

events.title: Aircraft Maintenance Certification
events.description: Arthur Ockwell certified repairs and alterations made to the aircraft N493LX.

events.title: FAA Program Letter Submission
events.description: Nextant Aerospace submitted a program letter to the FAA for the Beechjet 400A aircraft, detailing its use for research and development.

events.title: Installation of In-Flight Entertainment System
events.description: The installation of an In-Flight Entertainment System and other modifications were completed on the aircraft.

events.title: Major Repair and Alteration
events.description: Multiple repairs and alterations were made to the aircraft N493LX, including modifications to the baggage panel and installation of new pitot probes.

events.title: FAA Form 8110-3 Approval
events.description: Approval for electrical systems aspects of the aircraft modifications was granted.

events.title: Antenna Repair and Modifications
events.description: Various repairs and modifications were documented for the aircraft, including antenna repairs and pedestal cover extensions.

events.title: Approval of Aircraft Modifications
events.description: Multiple modifications and repairs were approved for the Hawker Beechcraft 400A aircraft, including alterations to the cockpit and structural components.

events.title: Agent Authorization
events.description: Flight Options, LLC authorized Nextant Aerospace, LLC as their agent for FAA actions regarding the aircraft.

events.title: Statement of Compliance
events.description: A statement of compliance with airworthiness standards for the Raytheon Aircraft model 400A was issued.

events.title: Issuance of Special Airworthiness Certificate
events.description: A Special Airworthiness Certificate was issued for the Beechjet 400A aircraft N493LX for research and development purposes.

events.title: Maintenance Work Completed
events.description: Maintenance work was completed on the aircraft N493LX, including the removal of various electronic components.

events.title: Major Repair and Alteration
events.description: A major repair and alteration was performed on the aircraft, including the installation of a new tail position light assembly.

events.title: Installation of Fireblocking
events.description: Fireblocking was installed on all seven cabin seats and the lavatory seat in accordance with FAA regulations.

events.title: Installation of Ground Proximity Warning System
events.description: A Sundstrand MK-VI Ground Proximity Warning System was installed in the aircraft.

locations: 26180 Curtiss Wright PKWY, Richmond Heights, OH 44143-1453
Cuyahoga County Airport, 355 Richmond, Cleveland, Ohio
Flight Options LLC, 26180 Curtiss Wright PKWY, Richmond Heights, Ohio
